jobs.title: Senior Data Engineer (ML for Waive Platform)
jobs.descriptionHtml:
**Job Description - what is this job about?

This is a key role for Waive. It is a partnership with the Chief Science and Technology Officer with the remit to technically execute the vision for the:
Delivery against immediate requirements of the clients
Delivery against long term growth and scale of the platform

This involves the following:

Setting up data pipelines (including social media APIs, NLP engine, deployment of predictive models) to enable scalable, repeatable, and secure data platform;
Being responsible for the infrastructure to ensure large scale and batch/real-time processing that leverage emerging technologies;
Deploying and driving development of highly performing machine learning algorithms;
Working with Chief Science and Technology Officer to create an honest, transparent and open minded team that is fun to work with (for the team and for the clients);

**Requirements - what do you need to be amazing at this job?

To be great at this job you will have experience in the following:

Coding, testing, and documenting new, large scale data and ML driven systems to create robust and scalable applications;
Ability to architect highly scalable distributed systems, using different open source tools
Building strategies for growth and roll out of the platform (from one to millions of users);
Being successful (or not, but knowing what went wrong) in executing those strategies;

On top of this, following characteristics will make the job right for you:

Bachelor's in computer science, computer engineering, or equivalent work experience as software engineer, data engineer, machine learning engineer or data scientist;
Understanding how algorithms work and have experience building and deploying high-performance algorithmic systems;
Really good and practical knowledge in different programming or scripting languages;
Have knowledge of data modeling and understanding of different data structures and their benefits and limitations under particular use cases;
Ambition to grow towards machine learning engineering and applied data science;
High awareness and care about the product as well as the people who build it and use it;

**Learnings and benefits - what are you getting out of this job?

Building something that has direct impact on how businesses operate and connect to their customers;
Being at the forefront of new, interesting data science and machine learning developments with a chance to publish and speak proudly about your work;
Working alongside industry recognised individuals;
Joy of open, honest, intellectually stimulating and flexible culture;

**Waive in short

Waive is a Consumer Intelligence Platform that uses AI to connect businesses with their future consumer, putting them front and centre of every decision.

**So what is Waive?

Brands today are struggling to remain relevant, failing to engage and retain audiences. We as consumers are always changing and adapting our preferences which are proving hard for organisations to understand. 90% of all digital activity a company publishes online simply fails.

You can help companies make better, more relevant products.

Waive combines media expertise, engineering excellence and science to address this problem. It gives content creators an innovative way to accurately understand future generations, from Millennials to Gen Z. We believe that data processed in an intelligent way, without invading user’s privacy can inform new products and services, your favorite shows, articles and interesting and engaging marketing campaigns.

Come and join us! It is fun to have an impact!

**How do we do it?

Waive’s platform is powered by multiple sources of data, including social APIs providing posts, content and associated metadata, as well as search and news RSS feeds for context. Natural Language Engine is processing text and turns it into meaningful features fed into prediction engine. Our algorithms are designed to understand viral effects and associations between users and concepts. The output feeds into sleek Waive app presenting predictions of current needs, trends and behaviours of consumers over the weeks and months ahead.

We are based in Google Cloud Platform and key technologies we use are BigQuery, CloudSQL, Kubernetes and most of the code base is in Python.
